episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including Anthony Trollope's anonymous publication despite his essay against it, a bizarre live TV event in India involving a failed attempt to kill with mind power, Queen Victoria's shoe-throwing tradition for good luck, and a unique chameleon species in Madagascar that is effectively extinct for part of the year.

facts.fact: Shortly after writing an essay on why writers shouldn't publish anonymously, Anthony Trollope published a book anonymously.
In 2008, a TV channel spent the day rescheduling shows so that millions of people in India could continue to watch a live broadcast of a man trying to kill another man using nothing but his mind.
The last thing that British soldiers going to the Crimean War saw was Queen Victoria throwing a shoe at them.
There is a chameleon in Madagascar which is effectively extinct for several months every year.
